entry.title: a museum on an aircraft carrier (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the FBI set up temporary offices in a museum on an aircraft carrier (pictured) while investigating the 9/11 terrorist attacks?

entry.title: Bill Duplissea (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Bill Duplissea has been said to have the "best eyes in baseball"?

entry.title: Episode 2351 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Episode 2351 of the Australian soap opera Home and Away was filmed in England, marking the first time the serial was filmed overseas?

entry.title: Dave Rudden (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Irish writer Dave Rudden has written a juvenile fantasy trilogy as well as several stories in the Doctor Who universe?

entry.title: A Friend of the Family (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that to portray a child abductor in A Friend of the Family, Jake Lacy took inspiration from the fearlessness and charisma of Danny Ocean and Steve McQueen?

entry.title: Thomas Mancuso (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Thomas Mancuso showed how deaths among factory workers could be understood by looking at social security data?

entry.title: mobilized nearly 300,000 troops for one invasion (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the royal chronicles report that the Kingdom of Ava mobilized nearly 300,000 troops for one invasion, but they probably only mobilized around a tenth of that?

entry.title: Republicopteron douseae (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the katydid-like fossil Republicopteron douseae possibly could not sing?
